She took it all away, and not just my madness, but the fake memories that Ikithon put in my head of my parents.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fake memories?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wanting to betr-- yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, there was a false memory? He tricked you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Into hearing their talks against the Empire, is that what it was?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, but it doesn't matter, because I still wanted to do it when I did it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you didn't know what you were doing--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were brainwashed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So what?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Programmed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Doesn't matter, I should have-- I'm a disgusting person. It doesn't matter. Anyway, all that gone, just like that. I ran. Not right away; I pretended like nothing had changed for several weeks. She was stark raving mad 15 minutes later herself, the woman who helped me. I killed one of Trent's people there, and took this. I pull out the necklace. This has been keeping me hidden for years. For five years.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you mean, hidden?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They can find who they want, but not with this. They cannot find me. I would really like to get into that library, because I would--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like to run again?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hmm? No, I like you all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You were just talking with Nott about running tomorrow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, that all depends on you, Beauregard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If I don't let you in?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you can keep a secret.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caleb, I'm good at keeping secrets. You heard us talking to Trent. You know he wants Yasha, and you're the only person who knows the atrocities that this man-- who utterly gave me the creeps, by the way, so I'm feeling a little bit validated in the fact that I read him pretty well--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think it's--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Anyway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just saying, you have a responsibility now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which is?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keep this guy from hurting more people.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, that's precisely why I want into this library.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want to take down Trent. Is that why you're doing all this? You want to take down Trent?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Among other things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah. What are you hoping to find?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Anybody can make lights. Anybody could send a message through a wire. I want to bend reality to my will.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caleb, you don't, though. No one wants that amount of power and responsibility.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, well, I told you why I am afraid of fire. So you are going to bring me to that library.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't worry, I'll take you to the library. There are two options here: you can selfishly try and go after this guy for your own vendetta, or you can use your motives to keep others from getting hurt in a very similar way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Both of those are appealing to me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. I know you just make dancing lights-- or at least you can feel like you just make dancing lights-- but those dancing lights make sure I can punch people in the fucking face whenever I can't see shit. A little bit of teamwork goes a long way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, good. I think Nott and I are going to retire now. Maybe you can go get that food for the others.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cool, man, cool. Kick me out of the room, I get it. Yep, all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want to stay here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I get it, it's fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, I'll leave.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But you don't have to leave the table.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not asking you to leave the table.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll keep your secret. We'll keep all this a secret. I don't think it's anything to be ashamed of, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughs slightly hysterically)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll figure it out in time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Goodnight, Beauregard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caleb (clicks). Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good evening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a charcuterie board coming to the girls' room, if anybody wants any.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (door slamming)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you and I good?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I swear to you that I will be at your side until you do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have an idea that can make that happen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. It will take a lot of hard work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A lot of books.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And a lot of books.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm in. Whatever you need, just tell me and I'll get it for you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull out the silver thread and I start putting it around the room, and go over some notes. I have some ideas already, some ideas I had, and I will stay up another hour or two before going to bed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Can we retrieve the rest of the group, please? Back to the table. (sharp exhale)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fart jokes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We got a Caleb lore dump.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the food arrives, the door opens, and the two--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, is the food arriving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The food has arrived as the companions and you have completed your evening--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, in that case, I am going to enter--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're cleaning up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am your god, long may I reign. Eat of my fruits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just ordered another fruit platter.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's good. I got through a lot of this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But long may he reign. Huzzah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're still pre-sleepy time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If there's something else you want to do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I want to go to the bathroom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then you may go to the bathroom if you'd like, and we're going to come back in the morning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thanks, Dad!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whenever the rest of our group returns?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Laura and Travis went home, they have a-- Yeah, Dateline was on?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 60 Minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, until they get here--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, no, Ashley's gone, now. It's just us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If anybody had any questions they want to ask. Laura's in the bathroom--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gotcha, no worries. (singing) Pregnancy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just looking forward to wearing a giant Platinum Dragon. That's all I wanted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's extravagant rooms, the inner chambers are well-decorated, the morning window-- as the drapery is left open, the sun comes through in golden beams--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, we missed our stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's morning-time now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the morning time. You guys come to consciousness.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We were going to play some Truth or Dare.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, it's fine. We did. We totally did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather yourselves. What are you guys doing with the day?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I guess we should go back to the Leaky Tap there, and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I ask for everybody to leave the room, except for-- (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have a cart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, we can load it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where are we going, before our errands? Or after our errands? What's the destination?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to get the map.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, the map!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we all back together again? Over breakfast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you guys have all woken up and gotten together again. We'll say for purposes of this that breakfast has been provided, like brought to your room as part of the staying over, but you finish your morning.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like, continental, or like French toast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Upper-end continental.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You guys totally missed it. We had the

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fjord and Jester made out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We had a crazy orgy in our room and you guys didn't

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Insight check! 11.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm happy to move in whatever direction anybody likes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you know I'm lying.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, I roll, too. I roll, too, because I was part of the lie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think she's lying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You backing her up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you roll shit, too?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I rolled a four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, they're lying through their teeth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before we leave, shouldn't we get a lay of the land? I mean, I trust my own ears, they're very large, but I barely heard half of a conversation. I don't even know really what's happening other than I heard that there's a war happening.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's the good side of this, then? What's your best-case scenario?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well maybe we should do some snooping around town and find out if there indeed is a war before we leave town.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If they lock the gates, or start conscripting--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will they do that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know what they'd do. All I know is I don't want to hang out, and obviously we've made a bit of a reputation for ourselves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But then, any city we go into, won't they lock us in that city?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We also have allies here. We have The Gentleman--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasp)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's an ally now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what we should do? You guys! Why don't we talk to Dolan about it? He would tell us!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dolan! We haven't even checked in with him!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, shit! We forgot to check in with him!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He was at the party last night! He was with that really cool guy from Marquet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have a bunch of allies. We can't just up and leave without at least saying, like, we're out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go talk to Dolan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Have you literally never left a town without telling everybody because, you know, there's a possibility you're going to get conscripted to go fight a war?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have never had allies before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go talk to Dolan, and then we'll leave, and we'll go to Hupperdook and then we'll go to Nogvurot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because those are funny-sounding names?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, because

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's also where there was a string of kidnappings.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: See,

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can disguise you as a kid and they could kidnap you and you could fight them from the inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't like this idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about we go say hi to Dolan, we'll run by The Gentleman, let him know that we're thinking about bouncing, and then we'll be on our way.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: May I take a look at that map, Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course, Yasha!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does anyone know who funds the Victory Pit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sure it's the city, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Probably.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could ask Dolan about that, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't think they don't know our names now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I say that while it was last night, I painted a picture with the new paint for my mom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to ask the front desk if they will send it to her. Back to our house in the Menagerie Coast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. They're less paints and more colored inks. You can purchase paints wherever you want to, but these are like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you have paints to do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'll paint it with the stuff I have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You paint her a little picture.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, colored inks? I didn't realize that!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Gel pens!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (clicking)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Postage for sending it off is simple enough at that size to be about five silver from here to Nicodranas.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we should be careful, because the longer we're in town, the more people we talk to, the more people might decide that they're invested in us staying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough. We'll keep our eyes open. To Dolan's then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To Dolan's first?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys go to Dolan's. You want to take a field trip?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where are y'all going?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have to take a trip to Pumat's for supplies and then--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Insight check! Just kidding. I'm good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Who's going where?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go wherever Caleb goes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pumat, library.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pumat, library. The rest of you guys are going to Dolan's?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To Dolan's. We'll meet up at Pumat's.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. That sounds good. You guys, Dolan's; we'll go library.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll do library first. Then we'll pull Matt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll pull Matt.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can pull Matt's soul.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pull Matt Key.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. As you guys--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (silly voice) Hey, you got your chocolate in my peanut butter!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys exit the Pillow Trove, and you make your way outside of the Tri-Spires, the first thing of note is the tone and the mood of the city has shifted dramatically.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a more festive atmosphere?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a party, girl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What little bits of sunlight came through the last day have completely absconded. The sky is covered in gray, nearly stormy clouds. There is an air of stress and question in the streets as you start seeing Righteous Brand groups making their way through. As you make your way through the north side of the Pentamarket, one of the town criers comes by shouting, "War declared on the Kryn by the King in retribution of attack on eastern "garrisons!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another one, a few moments later further down the way shouts out, "Righteous Brand "mobilizing east to protect our families! Spare what provisions you can to ensure victory and "support our defenders!" There are clusters of Righteous Brand groups, the full armored military outside of the Signet Wall that have come into the streets and are basically picking up provisions, asking for donations from anyone that can spare things for this scenario. They're grabbing horses from nearby stables, and it seems like since the close of the festival, through the night and into the morning, preparations have already kicked in on the military side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe not to Dolan's, then.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because we got to get the fuck out of here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, are we still all together, or are we already split up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're already split up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's no way we'll be able to get out of here before--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Back to Pumat's.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to do our best. We're going to see how it's going to be.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did we hear that, though?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm assuming we all heard it as we split.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You heard bits of it as you split off. You guys heard a bit. It says, "Crick incursion "threatening imperial borders! The Starosta recommends armed escorts for travel across the "valley!" A lot of these Righteous Brand soldiers are also saying goodbye to their families. There's a lot of people in big embraces with their children or with their parents, and there's very much the air of the morning before the big shift begins. The Crownsguard themselves are doing the best to keep the peace and inform people and not keep individuals from freaking out as much, but you do see a few arguments breaking out in the streets and there's that general tension of, "What's happening? What's going on? How bad is this?" But everything seems relatively under control. The Signet Wall, which is to the north side of the city, which is where all the military is usually situated-- you don't have a view beyond the wall, of course, but you can see that's where a large part of the Righteous Brand is emerging into the city from. Yeah, there is a definite building presence, and tension in the city in preparation for the shift eastward. You guys are heading to Dolan's still?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we still?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or what are you doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's not much to talk to him about, huh?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I mean.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should see if we should be some armed guards for some rich people going across the valley before, so that we have, you know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just a thought to check the board; also get our stuff from the Leaky Tap.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's what we can do while they're at the library.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a good idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are heading back to the Leaky Tap?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to go by the board first. The job board?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, the Taskboard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To see about being armed guards, and then we're going to go to the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Possible private escorts. Private escort, either north or--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Might be our best way out of town, actually. Good idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, as you're looking at the board a voice goes: "Oh, well that's perfect!" You see Voloshin, the Keeper of the Hall who you had previously interfaced with when you did your job in the sewers, comes out in his robes and he says, "We'd actually sent a page to look for you but "they must've missed you. The Lawmaster wishes to speak with you, would you come with me?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, of course we will.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Providence it is. Enter, please." He leads you inside the hall of the king and there are the two archways between the clerk's center and the Lawbearer's small shrine within the chamber. He leads you down the right hallway past two sets of doors and there's a third door on the right that is partially ajar. As you enter it, you see a spacious if rather minimalistic chamber. It's a bare chamber beyond a bookcase, the desk, with a long bench in front of it, and a series of three small windows where the sunlight comes through-- or the light, there's not really sunlight at the moment because of the weather. Beyond that, it's white marble and fairly empty. There at the desk you see, her arms sprawled looking down over clusters of parchments, the Lawmaster Orentha Stonegrasp. Her gray hair has tumbled past her shoulders and her bangs have been pulled back like a natural circlet, keeping it out of her eyes. He pushes you into the chamber, she has a dark brown fur robe on. The cold morning air makes the room, especially the dark marble, very cold. She keeps it on for warmth. She looks up from the papers and greets you with a smile and goes, "Thank you for "coming. That was mighty fast. Have a seat, if you don't mind. Thank you, Voloshin, close the door, "if you could." "Of course, my dear." He closes the door, leaves you in there. "I wasn't expecting "such a rapid response, but I appreciate your expediency."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we were right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's fantastic. Please, have a seat. I'd like to discuss a few things with you if you don't "mind. First off, congratulations yesterday. That was quite a display and a fantastic victory. Well--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we going to war?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Access to empirical halls, and individuals otherwise restricted to the general populace."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would we get healing potions?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "When they're available, those supplies are a bit stretched thin and put toward the front "lines. We could probably muster what we can. Could I hope for your help on this?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's quite the offer. Seem to be opening up the whole kit and caboodle for us here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Dire times make for dire circumstances. We don't take lightly the ask that we're giving here--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We understand your position, unfortunately you find us in a precarious time. As you can see, we don't have all of our fellows here with us and this morning's news caught us unawares. We'd need a fair bit of time to consider your offer, I'm afraid. We can't give you a yes or no right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I understand, that's fine." She smiles lightly, the crow's nests in her eyes folding in a bit. "I hold no grudge against you should you decline. That's all."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We do appreciate the offer and we can't wait to talk to our friends about it, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Insight check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, should you be interested, the first contract I can discuss, if you choose to sign with "us. It does offer a 10,000 gold bounty."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (choking)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can't tell you until you sign the contract."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why not? It sounds like a lot of money for something, though!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have sympathy for your situation. Will you be here in a few hours if we need to return?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh I have no choice, I'm in the process--" and she gestures to the papers below her and there's a stack of approval letters and reports that have to be put out there. She's dividing what forces that she can allow to go the eastern front and sticking her feet in the sand on what things she needs to maintain order in the city.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You have our deepest sympathies at your position. This is obviously going to be a very difficult time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, the issue here is that many of our finest investigators and hunters will be sent to "the east and as such many of the criminals and individuals that we were in the process of finding "and bringing to justice will now go free or return and run rampant."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If only my friend were here. Me and my friend Nott are really good at solving crimes, we're the best investigators.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, consider what I'm saying. At the very least, come back and notify me."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's why I'm here. I wish to fight for this land "that I call home, to protect those who cannot protect themselves, and combat the destructiveness "and selfishness of anarchy. Utopia's impossible, I know that, but I do what I can to make life as "livable as possible. Anyway, go speak with your friends, and I'll be here if you need me."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you think the war will make it all the way here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If the war makes it here, then we're in far more trouble than I anticipated."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough, your asks are fair. We'll return, quickly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door opens behind and Voloshin leads you back out of the King's Hall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you ever need anyone to talk to because you feel really stressed out, I'm here. I'm a good healer, mentally.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She gives a nod and a wave.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We turn and leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are escorted out of the King's Hall and left back out to the streets.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa, that was crazy!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was crazy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a lot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 10,000 gold! What do you think it is? Do you think it's a dragon or something crazy like that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's The Gentleman.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do too, or something just as sinister.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I wonder if there's any way to find out somehow what it is before accepting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like The Gentleman probably works with the city, you guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like 10,000 gold is buying an awful lot of cooperation. More cooperation than I think I'm capable of.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's find the others and get our story straight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Back to The Leaky Tap, then? Get our stuff together?

lines.name: TRAVIS, ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then we'll meet them at the shop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys get to The Leaky Tap, you see near the front door a young page wearing similar, though simpler, robes as Voloshin and members of the King's Hall, who approaches and goes, "Oh, hi! "I'm sorry, I was sent to give you this summons from the Lawmaster."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've already been, it's all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well," and then runs off. You guys gather your supplies and start making your way back towards the Pentamarket. The three of you, where are you going?

lines.name: SAM, LIAM
lines.text: The library.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make your way towards the Archive of the Cobalt Soul here in Zadash. The same beautiful building with the large, steepled tower top.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Button up. I turn to Nott. How do I look? Do I have any makeup running?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you wear makeup?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like once a week.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think it's worn off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, good. Let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should I be--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That would be helpful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you think I should be more of a normie for this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to do the same thing that I did the other day. I am going to cast Disguise Self and make the gigantic glasses and change my cloak to a similar shade of blue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's that thing you guys do, Mother's Love? What's that situation?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's for when we steal things, and I pretend to be his baby and he pretends to be my mama. Then when they're looking at the cute baby, he steals something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. You could go with the first half of that plan, but without the second half that involves the stealing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They would let you bring a mother and her baby into the library?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll be a dwarf.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm more concerned about bringing in a man and a goblin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can disguise myself as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Normally when we do Mother's Love, Nott stabs people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. You do know how to adjust in certain circumstances, though, right? You do know how to improv based on the current surroundings, though, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, this city's under lockdown, can we go into the library?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll cast Disguise Self and be a little halfling girl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Beauregard, you come with companions."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do. Spreading that Cobalt love.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fantastic. What is it you seek this day?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Me? I am interested in the history of the greatest arcanists of all time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Please, do sign in here."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's your name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And your friend?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Veth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ham and Beth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not super crowded. There's maybe eight other people in the facility at this time. Obviously the city is very occupied with other things at the moment. It's not like there's a huge, constant need for this, and the people in here are usually regulars. A lot of older folks, people who tend to spend their later life wanting to read and learn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Memberships.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are led to a section. Madeer reads through. "Arcanists, you say? Historically? Are we "talking Age of Arcanum?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am looking for histories, accounts of people who pushed the boundaries of what can be done over the ages. The firsts. I am interested in more than what is typical, at least as much as can be known. Do you follow me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I believe so."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's a magic fan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja,

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Little heavy-handed, man. Like, really heavy-handed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A few tomes are retrieved. "This here is a recollection of what elements of historical "significance could be pulled from the remnants of the Age of Arcanum, pre-Calamity. There are a "great number of mages out there, though many of them befell darker interests. But here are those "books. If you're looking for more modern mages, we have historical information on the past 200 years "of empirical magecraft and powerful wizards in that realm."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about the unexplained?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Explain what you mean by 'unexplained,' please."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I said you were already being too heavy-handed!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Questions. There is a certain amount of knowledge in the schools of this empire, and then there are questions. Theorizing, philosophy of the arcane.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That would be more Soltryce Academy material. They do lay claim to most of those "theoretical discussions and research. The Cerberus Assembly would be the keepers of those research "endeavors."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excellent, I shall go there next.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have a book here on the Cerberus Assembly, if that would be of interest to you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These tomes are presented to you. You can spend time to read if you'd like. Madeer watches the entire time, like a hawk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I start reading.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which book do you go through first?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will start with the first, the oldest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Are you absorbing it, or are you skimming through?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This one, I am absorbing it. I will read it cover to cover.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cover to cover will take you the better part of the day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm a speed reader, and an average novel takes an hour to an hour and a half for a speed reader to read.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're a speed reader, but this is also very dense material, and it is essentially a historical theorizing on historical elements they've been able to piece together. I'd say by the time you've gotten here, it'd be about noon in the day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm holding three tomes, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, and I'd say you'd finish this book by about 3:00.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I take a moment to skim, ten minutes through each one, and get the barest idea of what I would find inside each.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You want me to just tell you all the history?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I'm trying to figure out if I were to look at a couple of pages at once from three different books--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you looking for? You have to give me something to go on here, otherwise this is going to turn into an hour and a half of me telling you about the history of the Age of Arcanum.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want the furthest extent of transmutation and changing reality.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It speaks of, in the Age of Arcanum, there were floating cities. There was arcane technology utilized in that period, which was this magical utopia, but a lot of that was lost in the war, partially because a lot of these mages, when they had developed magic to this point, weren't satiated with their mortal capabilities, and that was when they were easily corruptible by the betrayer gods. Then it goes into discussion of the Calamity. Magics that can alter the fabric of reality exist out there. Some of them appear to be myth, some have been wiped from time and history because they've been voted too dangerous and they're supposedly under lock and key in other places of the world, if not completely eradicated because it was not fit to leave them in the hands of mortals.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This was in one of these tomes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then I will focus on that, because I'm interested in that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It speaks on theories and manipulations of-- if you're looking for things reality-based, reality's a big scope. Transmutation specifically, most of what you can glean from this discusses the idea of turning from one creature to another, turning from one substance to another, how they would be able to build fortresses out of stone and then turn it to diamond for extra protective elements, and those were the great palaces of that age.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know my main interests. Do I find anything of that in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Accelerating time to a certain degree becomes very dangerous, and there is talk of some mages that have attempted to reverse time in short stints, and that process is both very taxing and in the past has completely annihilated those who toyed with that power. It speaks specifically of two different mages who believed that they could possibly alter choices, alter elements of their past to benefit their future, their gaining of power and influence. One was turned to dust, the other was never seen again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I spend all my time with that book.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Madeer. How's it been? How's it going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has been frustrating, but fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking Zeenoth, am I right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zeenoth is a great friend.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, he's a great friend! Great guy. Great guy, that Zeenoth. Has Dairon left?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I have not seen her this morning, but I don't know if she's left or not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cool, cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You read through that tome. It's about three in the afternoon now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Caleb, not going to conquer the world in a library visit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you give me two more hours?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I cannot give you two more hours. I can't. I will gouge my eyes out with a fucking pencil if I give you two more hours.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How about one more hour? We'll all compromise.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about 30 more minutes?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have something in your neverending flask?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course, would you like a drink? Are we allowed to drink in here? Why are you carrying around a cup?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I skim the book on the Cerberus Assembly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Was there when it was built and is currently considered the leader of the Assembly. It speaks of Marquis Jenna Iresor who is the Archmage of Industry. One of the younger members of the Assembly. There is Master Doolan Tversky who is the Archmage of Dysology.

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Dysology?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: D-Y-S-O-L-O-G-Y. There is--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you reading these things out loud?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, he is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I could say I'm muttering it under my breath.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is Lord Athesias Uludan who is the Archmage of Diplomatic Union. There is Lady Vess DeRogna who is the Archmage of Antiquity. I'll send you these later. It's fine. I'll send you an email.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We now have something that rivals a shopping episode. It's called the library.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is Headmaster Zivan Margolin who is the Archmage of Conscription. Then there is Headmaster Oremid Hass who is the Archmage of Cultivation. Those are the eight members currently.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I have to give a small golf clap for--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You wrote all this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's The Silmarillion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, there is a lot more information!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, when you were muttering there, did you say Dolan Tversky?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doolan.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not Dolan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Similar name.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's nothing in this. You handed it back, I thought there was going to be something in it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, I will say that I got my fill. I can feel this one's radiating--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, burrowing vision into your neck.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to stay for 17 more hours, but I'm ready to go. I am good. I am done. Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course! Good day."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, Madeer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good to see you, Beauregard." He escorts you out of the Archive.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb looks at the thousands of books that he did not read and leaves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, and there's a whole second level above the spiral staircase.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And we count our fucking blessings.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, you're not going to find any answers in any of those books.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's go find the others.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've already left the city.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are in Rexxentrum.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're in a different campaign.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you mean it's been 17 years, Pumat? What do you mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys, what have you been up to during this time? Because it's been a number of hours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We ate like three shepherd's pies. We fucking killed a guy and hid him in the room. We stuck him next to the skellington.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was great.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We did our taxes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Molly told all of our fortunes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've gathered all your materials. You went and checked on your cart, which is now currently--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We just pushed the giant rotting head out of it and left it on the street.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that is a nasty fucking manticore head. The flesh has sloughed off of it at this point. Yeah, it's pretty rough. You have your cart, the horses are still there. The horses you had, at least.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, you guys. I never used my fate thingy yesterday because I'm stupid. Did you guys want to use it today?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, did I not tell you about this thing? Oh my gosh, you guys, you know the weird little thing that we stole?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, it gives you this-- okay, so you focus on it and you go to this place and you can see it and there's this little gray ball and it goes "Touch me!" and then you go "Okay!" Then it comes out, and it goes in your chest, and you get control of your fate for one time in a day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What? What do you mean you get control of your fate?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, like basically like if you fuck up or something like that then you get to fix it, maybe.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can you go back and--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's like all of a sudden you feel a little lucky, maybe.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you want to try it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, sure. Why not?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's hide next to the body that we just killed so that you can try it in the cellar so that nobody sees, because we should probably be careful pulling this thing out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would imagine right now especially.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I pull out the box. Just focus on it, Fjord! I'll protect you!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I have to touch it or just look at it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't remember. I think you just--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll do both. Are you doing it, too?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It can only do one person in a day, but we'll pass it around the group, so if you want it today, Fjord, then Yasha, you can do it tomorrow.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you focus on it, there's nothing really there until your hand touches it and then there's a momentary connection. You feel the thrumming of the object, this dull heartbeat. Your vision goes tunneled until you're pulled into this space of light and stars, distant gases and colors. There you see, beyond this brief journey, this sense of self dissipating. At the moment where it gets a little scary and you being to lose a sense of personal identity, you see this tiny gray mote of energy before you that's also pulsing with that same pattern. You instinctively reach out and feel as you absorb it into yourself, and there, the fragment of--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did he say anything when he touched it? Like Caleb did?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you say anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you say anything? No, you were silent the whole time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your vision has come back to you and you feel this--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm half sea monster!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was I supposed to say something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's just when Caleb did it, he was like, "I love you, Mom and Dad!" Then he started crying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, no. It was a crazy trip though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you feel like you have control over your fate?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you feel...lucky?

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I close up the box. I put it back in the bag.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go to Pumat's and let's get the rest of them together, I'm sure by now--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We will ride the cart. Do you guys really think we probably shouldn't become legionnaires, then?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No? We should leave town?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we should get out of town while the getting's good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That lady's really nice, though. She's like a grandma.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 10,000 gold, I mean, shit. Wouldn't mind earning 10,000 and then bouncing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to go to Pumat's as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're conscripted once you start earning that 10,000.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you're conscripted as long as you stay in town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder how the contract works? I bet it's like a magical contract or something like that where you sign it and then they have like your soul!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or you sign it and then the next time you come across some soldiers of the Empire, they have you executed for treason for running off on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that would be bad.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, we should explore this idea, but maybe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, let's go to Pumat's.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say for the purposes of expediency, and you guys lolling around a little bit to try and catch up, you all arrive at Pumat Sol's in roughly the same time in the Pentamarket. As you enter the interior of the chamber, you can see the three Pumats are dusting and staring off because there are currently no other people making purchases inside. Most of the business and chaos-- people dealing with the initial shock and preparation stage of this coming scuffle with the East. As you enter, the first Pumat glances over in your direction. "Oh, hello there! It's real "interesting morning times. What can I do for you?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Had a bit of a tussle. Guess what we're back for?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet he doesn't have any more yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Healing potions, do you have any?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately, you guys have pretty much cleaned me out, and what little bits I had were "snatched up bright and early this morning by the Righteous Brand."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should have bought some earlier! Do you know of anyone else that would have some?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Generally, I don't like to plug rival purveyors here in the city."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To get healing potions?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Because we're at war."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "This time of year," like it happens every year?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, but I mean it's that time of year right now apparently where war happens. That's a "problem."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you going to go to war, Pumat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) "No!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you're such a powerful person, don't you think you would be helpful?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't think that's any of our fates right now, isn't that right, boys?" They're all like, "Yeah, no that's--" "No, warfare's not my thing."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know we were in here very recently. You haven't got any overnight special deliveries of anything interesting, have you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately, you've taken the bulk of what was there, other than a few odds "and ends that you couldn't afford previously."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you have any of that paper that I have been purchasing so much of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We got a little more paper, yeah."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could I purchase, say, 200 gold worth of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mister Prime back there is hard at work." He turns back and you hear this voice like, "Yeah! Got a lot of stock to kick up now! You cleared me out for a "while, which thanks for that!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was the pearl again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let's see here. Yeah, you use a command word and it allows you to regain one of your spells."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much was it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This one runs you roughly about 350 gold pieces."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would like to buy that please, thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All righty, by all means."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it one use only, and then it's gone forever?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Once per day."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What was that other item you had?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, here you are, if you would like to--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it the Pearl of Power?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I had that as Vex!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then these here are this pair of bracers are able "to do a similar scenario given you don't have too many types of hide or metal in the way to prevent "the enchantment from protecting you, but--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does it work with medium armor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, nah, it only works if you don't have any armor or shield."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, what does it do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No armor, not even light armor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, sorry."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you wear armor, Yasha?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Beauregard does not either.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much are those?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That one will run you back about 1,200 gold."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe not, forget that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We'll come back for another day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you have any enchanted crossbow bolts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pumat III, if you don't mind." "I got it, already listening to you, don't worry." He goes up a small ladder in the far corner into an attic place and you hear some rustling around as the other Pumats are there patiently watching. "So yeah, crazy war times, huh?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How much for that shield?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, this here enchanted shield will run you about 550 gold pieces."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think I'm all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fair enough." About five minutes pass and then the Pumat comes down, he's got a small, bound cluster of bolts and he goes, "Hey, so it's all we got, but we've got a batch here of ten enchanted "crossbow bolts. These upon firing should offer a small batch of fiery impact on whatever you strike "with them."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For each of these, it's 50 gold per bolt."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take two bolts please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Two bolts, here you go."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He passes them over to you. These bolts, upon impact, do an additional 1d8 fire damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have two of them, and it's one use only.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. 1d8 fire damage. Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may have a chance of recovering them, depending.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, cool. What did we decide? Are we leaving town or are we doing something else?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We got an offer to work for the city, to be legionnaires. To protect it while its troops, hunters, and mercenaries are going to the front lines. There are bounties of up to 10,000 gold in reward if we stay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, do we want to stay? Are there things here that you need?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I defer to the group. I think we work well together and whatever you think's best.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 10,000 gold is a lot of money.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They want someone really important dead is what it sounds like to me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sounds like an expensive enemy to make.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Our other option being fleeing the city? There were no postings for--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We already pushed the nasty head out of our wagon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. Should have done that like a week ago. Good call. Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm legitimately happy to go in any direction far away from the front line, personally.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is joining the city joining the war? Is that what they made it sound like?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Believe so.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's a slippery slope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Joining the city is protecting the city, more than it is joining the war.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's conscription.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The city's a part of the empire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you're under contract, for 15 gold a week.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about your interests in the Hall of Erudition here and the Academy?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh the Soltryce?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'd like to see it, but I guess I'm not in a terrible rush.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The big one's in Rexxentrum, anyway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we'll make gold wherever we go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I agree. They say there's kids disappearing up north?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If we stop by the merchants' guild we may still be able to be armored escorts for people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or we could just leave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or we could just go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Check by the merchants' guild, see our options, and then make the decision from there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is not as massive a gain, but there is not as high a risk for whatever this 10,000 gold target is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, let's not do that one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Play it safe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just be armored guards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This means we're staying together, though?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I thought yes, that was a given right? I mean, we all work so well together.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We make really good roommates!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We do make such good roommates.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, Beau, do you want us to stay together?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we make a good team. I think there's more to be had here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It might run out, who knows. I'm not an optimist, but think there's still more to be had.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we make a polite exit at the least or do we just bugger out?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She seemed pretty heartfelt, I think a polite exit would be thoughtful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm fair for that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Merchants' guild then polite exit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, maybe we'll rustle up W.C., Loo, John, Crapper, Shitter, and Toilet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh that's right, our horsies!

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any other business you want to do before you decide to leave the city?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you want to swing by and see if-- Yeah, can we pop into the other shop? The old Grace of the Wild and see if they have any healing potions, just to check out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just in case.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In the interest of time...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do they have any?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the interest of time, Jasna Bree, who is a rather eccentric woman with wild black hair, a slightly hard to follow disposition, greets you and is like, "Hi! Welcome! Glad you could make it! "Healing potions, yes. Unfortunately kind of already cleared out. I'm so sorry. Give me a week, "I will have a fresh batch of healing potions, and I'd be happy to help."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Definitely be back in a week. Wait, do you have any herbalism kits?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do! I do!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh great! Could I buy some--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have four!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For each it's-- let me check." She goes into her ledger.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The DM's Guide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it works out well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would I be able to make potions of healing with this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With herbalism kits?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe you would, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can make potions of healing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, it is five gold per.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh great. How many do you have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to have proficiency with it to make a potion of healing. Are you proficient with herbalism kit?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know how I would tell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be under your proficiencies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, then no. Oh no, I only have proficiency with a forgery kit and a disguise kit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, then fuck it! I don't want that shit!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to go back to Pumat's. I'm going to buy that damn shield.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! There you go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If she has the materials to make acid, I'll buy it from her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, she easily has materials and sells them to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I couldn't make potions with alchemist supplies, could I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not potions. You can make poisons, acid, various alchemical concepts, but that's the gist of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does she have any badass weapons? Any badass sticks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. She is purely a purveyor of salves and natural remedies and--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ointments.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I ask a question?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With a healer's kit, can you heal people when you're not in combat? Or is it just for stabilizing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is actually pretty cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay. I'll look at that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It turns anybody into a combat healer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we go say goodbye to somebody and leave?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we checking the merchants' to see if there's any armed escort requests out of the merchants' guild?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's helming that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fjord!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm coming with her.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll help you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Us three. Oh. That was bad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's helping you with it. It's advantage on you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best you can tell, most of them are in the process of getting ready to figure out what their next endeavor is. Those that would be leaving won't be leaving for a few days. If you hang around, you may be able to pick up that kind of work.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. That's something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. I think we'd have to wait. Maybe we should just go?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Should we say our goodbyes to Orentha?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll swing by and say, sorry we are declining.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys make your way back to the King's Hall, you are escorted back into Orentha Stonegrasp's office. "I see you've returned. I appreciate your expediency in getting back to me." Her crackling Southern drawl breaking through with her bright dwarven smile. "Considering what we've "discussed, what have you come to a conclusion on?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we are probably not going to be able to help out right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I understand."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not you. It's us. We're not ready for that kind of commitment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I understand, that's all right."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're going to make an adventuring party very happy some day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You really will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I hope so. We'll send someone else after the Hawker."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: After the what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Hawker."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's a Hawker?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't worry about it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does anyone know what a Hawker is?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which spelling are you using for that word? A-W-K? O-C-K?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: H-A-W-K.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like a monster or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. He actually was a legionnaire for us about five years back, but then went rogue, and we "believe had ties with the Myriad and became a powerful tent-pole here in the Marrow Valley. We "had him cornered in Deastok about three months ago by a team of crownsguard under the leadership of "Carlos Ventuga. But this Hawker slew Carlos and fled south into the Wuyun Gorge and disappeared "into the Menagerie Coast. We're having to send whoever we can to try and retrieve him and bring him "back alive."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: From the Menagerie Coast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The opposite direction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Menagerie Coast is really freaking cool, you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So many choices!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit, that sounds really cool!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you need more time, that's fine."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you guys think? Hold on, can we talk about this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Quick huddle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pros and cons.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm happy just to leave the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pros, we get to visit the Menagerie Coast, which is always really cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pro, 10,000 gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we have a time limit on when we'd be able to get him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, but the longer it takes, the easier he probably has vanishing into the south."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Makes sense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We sent a troupe after him about eight weeks ago, and I fear they may not be coming back "at this point. We intended to send some of our top investigators from the capital after this "bounty--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Investigators!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what they said!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's our job!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're really good at it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's 10,000 gold alive, 5,000 dead."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we were like, let's go after this guy, and then after that, we'll talk about being under contract? Like this can be a test situation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately, if this is to happen, I need you under contract."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need some tea or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm good, I appreciate your conscientiousness."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A lozenge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm all right, but thank you."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have a lozenge?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't, I just feel bad for her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Shouldn't be offering things that you don't have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's fine."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What does the contract entail?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Retrieving this man and bringing him back here for justice."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How long are we in contract with you? Just for this, or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The contract has you as a legionnaire, and as part of that you just--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Forever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, until we decide to mutually end your service."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mutually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, if you wish out of it, we can discuss it, it's fine. But I mean as opposed to deserting "is the problem."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you want to hire more legionnaires to go kill an ex-legionnaire who wasn't legionnaire-y enough for you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he ran away when he was a legionnaire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He ran away and then allied himself, we believe, with the Myriad and then has since, upon "attempting to bring him in, murdered some of our finest men."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Myriad does some scary stuff, you guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we happen to bring him in even if we weren't under contract--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Part of the bounty would still apply I'm sure."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much of the bounty?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably half."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's an option.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But if we were part of the contract then we would get access to a bunch of stuff.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Think about it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Think about it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we decide, can we talk about this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Huddle up again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys can discuss this over the next week if you want. You don't need to decide this right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm too tired to make proper decisions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There, waiting--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is where we hit the save point. I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry, don't mean to bother you. If you have a "moment, things are getting strange around here and The Gentleman may have a bit of work for you." (groaning)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're the prettiest girl in town.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should have left in the middle of the goddamn night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll pick up from there next week. You guys made quite a display last night in the Victory Pit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You just made it three times as complicated in seven seconds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Knew it was coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Picking up on that. However, you guys do level up. You hit level five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does that mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Level five?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That means let's all roll some hit points to finish off the evening here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh gosh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you get, Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled a seven plus three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whatever your constitution modifier is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus three, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten extra hit points to Beau. What'd you get, Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I roll a d8?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a d8.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got a seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Everybody rolls a d8?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb is a d6, he's the only one. Warlock is a d8, but it adds a plus.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled a four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you get?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Four, plus I've a constitution modifier.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was a d8?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: d8, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six plus four, ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh I'm rolling an eight as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are as a cleric, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five, okay. d10 for you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: d10 for me. Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are all rolling above average, nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: d12 for you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nice. 11?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shit, you guys rolled really good this time, well done!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Plus two?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll be your constitution modifier, so a plus two to that for 13 hit points. So add 11 and it should give you 13.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh it'll go. Here, let me get-- Over on this side, you can manage your levels.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For Molly, Beau, and Yasha, that means your attack action now does two attacks. You get an extra ki point. Casters all get level three spells. That's pretty great. And your proficiency bonus goes up by one. So all your proficient skills, proficient attacks, spell DCs, and spell attack modifiers all go up by one. I think it's all going to be included in there already, in the app. It's a good level.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I add six to the rolled HP?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's everybody's hit points at, what are the new totals?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau also gets Stunning Strike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My hit points are super low, you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's Uncanny Dodge?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The best thing ever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He got Uncanny Dodge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sneak attack bonus 3d6! Oh shit. All the dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is my favorite part. Watching people realize what they get when they level up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh wait, I get a bunch of weird shit, we're going to have to have a talk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Holy shit. I'm unstoppable!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's part of the reason that Vax survived so much in the last campaign.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I get Revivify now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I use that once a day? Once a round?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's just your reaction, once a round.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Once a round?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Holy shit. I'm a golden god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I get a new blood curse. I want to have a conversation about that before we go into that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you do get another blood curse, you get to choose.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have Dispel Magic you guys!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So does Yasha, no big deal.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, that's a big deal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then you get, of course, 3rd-level spells, and you get another invocation. You can mess with it later.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where we're leaving off, are we going to come back? Because it's the end of the day, are we going to come back at the end of the day or are we going to come back next morning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's late afternoon at this point. You guys are coming back right as you met with Kara there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great, so you can go back to the library next time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (chanting) Level five, level five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll be back next Thursday, see where this goes as choices, paths, avenues, and possibilities all begin to arise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Too many options.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're engrossed in leveling up. This is the joy of Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm excited to see what insane shit I can do. My proficiency bonus, did it automatically go up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it automatically puts it up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Holy shit, you have so many hit points.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to go to Taco Bell on the last 45 minutes of my birthday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, let's do it. Happy birthday.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 45 minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I love you, we're going to get Taco Bell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is the best birthday meal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [music]
